title.narrative: North Core/Dorsale Nord Regional Power Interconnector Project

description.narrative: The Project Development Objectives are : (i) to increase the capacity to trade electricity between Nigeria, Niger, Benin and Burkina Faso, (ii) to reduce the cost of supply of electricity in Niger, Benin and Burkina Faso through increased regional energy trade, and (iii) to increase access to electricity in Burkina Faso.

condition.narrative: Except as the Association shall otherwise agree, the WAPP shall ensure that none of the provisions of the Safeguards Instruments isabrogated, amended, repealed, suspended or waived

FA Benin, Schedule 2, Section I.E: The Recipient shall ensure that the activities under Part 1 of the Project are carried out inaccordance with the Action Plan, as further detailed in the PIM, all under terms and conditions satisfactory to the Association andto the Participating Countries

FA Benin, Schedule 2, Section I.E: The Recipient shall ensure that the activities under Part 1 of the Project are carried out inaccordance with the Action Plan, as further detailed in the PIM, all under terms and conditions satisfactory to the Association andto the Participating Countries

FA Benin- Revised: 2. Schedule 2, Section I.C par.9(ii):No later than 120 days after countersignature of this Amendment, update theESMP, in form and substance acceptable to the Association and in accordance with the provisions of Section I.C of this Schedule soas to be appropriate for the inclusion and implementation of Part 5 of the Project.

FA Benin- Revised: 2. Schedule 2, Section I.C par.9(iii):No later than 120 days after countersignature of this Amendment, recruit asocial specialist for the CEB team for the implementation of the RAP Action Plan.

FA Benin- Revised: 2. Schedule 2, Section I.C par.9(iii):No later than 120 days after countersignature of this Amendment, recruit asocial specialist for the CEB team for the implementation of the RAP Action Plan.
FA Benin- Revised: 2. Schedule 2, Section I.C par.9(iv):No later than 120 days after countersignature of this Amendment, establisha GRM for the execution of the corrective action plan for this audit.
FA Benin- Revised: 2. Schedule 2, Section I.C par.9(iv):No later than 120 days after countersignature of this Amendment, establisha GRM for the execution of the corrective action plan for this audit.

FA Benin- Revised:Schedule 2, Section I.C par.9(i):No later than 120 days after countersignature of this Amendment and prior to thecommencement of any works under Category 3,update the ESIA in form and substance acceptable to the Association and in accordancewith the provisions of Section I.C of this Schedule so as to be appropriate for the inclusion and implementation of Part 5 of theProject.

FA Benin-Schedule 2, Section I.C par.9(ii):No later than 120 days after countersignature of this Amendment, update the ESMP, inform and substance acceptable to the Association and in accordance with the provisions of Section I.C of this Schedule so as to beappropriate for the inclusion and implementation of Part 5 of the Project.

FA Benin: Schedule 2, Section I.C par.9(i):No later than 120 days after countersignature of this Amendment and prior to thecommencement of any works under Category 3, update the ESIA in form and substance acceptable to the Association and in accordancewith the provisions of Section I.C of this Schedule so as to be appropriate for the inclusion and implementation of Part 5 of theProject.

FA Burkina Faso, Schedule 2, Section I.E: The Recipient shall ensure that the activities under Part 1 of the Project are carriedout in accordance with the Action Plan, as further detailed in the PIM, all under terms and conditions satisfactory to theAssociation and to the Participating Countries

FA Burkina Faso, Schedule 2, Section I.E: The Recipient shall ensure that the activities under Part 1 of the Project are carriedout in accordance with the Action Plan, as further detailed in the PIM, all under terms and conditions satisfactory to theAssociation and to the Participating Countries

FA Niger, Schedule 2, Section I.E: The Recipient shall ensure that the activities under Part 1 of the Project are carried out inaccordance with the Action Plan, as further detailed in the PIM, all under terms and conditions satisfactory to the Association andto the Participating Countries

FA Niger, Schedule 2, Section I.E: The Recipient shall ensure that the activities under Part 1 of the Project are carried out inaccordance with the Action Plan, as further detailed in the PIM, all under terms and conditions satisfactory to the Association andto the Participating Countries

FA Nigeria, Schedule 2, Section I, A, 3: The Recipient shall take all action to cause TCN to make available to the WAPP, free ofcharge, the premises required for the central office of the Project Management Unit to be established in Abuja and to functioneffectively to implement Parts 1, 3 and 4 of the project.

FA Nigeria, Schedule 2, Section I, E. The Recipient shall take all measures, including through the Implementation Agreement, tocause the PMU: (i) to establish, not later than three (3) months after the effective date; and (ii) thereafter, to cause the PMU tomaintain, operate and publicize the availability of, throughout project implementation, a functional grievance redress mechanismfor Parts 1.A.1, 3.A, 3.B.2 and 4.A.2 of the project, with adequate staffing and processes, and in form and substance satisfactoryto the Association, , to register, hear and determine fairly and in good faith all complaints raised in relation to Parts 1.A.1,3.A, 3.B.2 and 4.A.2 of the project, and take all measures necessary to implement the determinations made by such mechanism in amanner satisfactory to the Association.

FA Nigeria, Schedule 2, Section I.F: The Recipient shall ensure that the activities under Part 1 of the Project are carried out inaccordance with the Action Plan, as further detailed in the PIM, all under terms and conditions satisfactory to the Association andto the Participating Countries

FA Nigeria, Schedule 2, Section IB, 4: Without limitation upon the provisions of Section 5.03 of the General Conditions, theRecipient shall provide, or cause to be provided, adequate security to the WAPP, the contractors, sub-contractors and other partiesinvolved in the implementation of Parts 1.A.1, 3.A, 3.B.2 and 4.A.2 of the project

FA WAPP, Schedule 2, Section 1, D: the Recipient shall ensure that the activities under Part 1 of the Project are carried out inaccordance with the Action Plan, as further detailed in the PIM, all under terms and conditions satisfactory to the Association andto the Participating Countries

FA WAPP, Schedule 2, Section I, A, 2(b). To the extent that the WAPP establishes a local office in a Participating Country, suchoffice shall be established not later than twelve (12) months after the effective date and shall be responsible for day-to-daysupervision of the technical and safeguard aspects for the works to be carried out under the Project in the ParticipatingCountries. The composition and appointment of the personnel in the local office shall be finalized under terms of reference andwith personnel with qualifications and experience satisfactory to the Association and which shall ensure the following functions:(i) Project coordination at the local level; (ii) technical supervision and management of contract; (iii) technical fieldsupervision of the works; and (iv) field supervision of environmental and social safeguards.

FA WAPP, Schedule 2, Section I, C. 1. The WAPP shall ensure that Parts 1, 3 and 4.A of the project are implemented with due regardto appropriate health, safety, social, and environmental standards and practices, and in accordance with the Safeguards Instruments.

FA WAPP, Schedule 2, Section I, H(i). The WAPP shall not later than three (3) months after the effective date, set up a“multi-project” computerized accounting system, satisfactory to the Association, to fit the project needs and generate usefulinformation and financial statements.

FA WAPP, Schedule 2, Section I, H(ii). The WAPP shall not later than six (6) months after the effective date: (A) recruit aqualified and experienced internal auditor, under terms of reference satisfactory to the Association, to be responsible for thesubmission of semi-annual internal audit reports to the Association not later than forty-five (45) days after the end of theperiod covered by the audit report; and (B) appoint an external auditor, with qualifications and experience satisfactory to theWorld Bank and under terms of reference approved by the Association

FA WAPP, Schedule 2, Section I, I. The WAPP shall, not later than three (3) months after the effective date, establish, andthereafter maintain, operate and publicize the availability of, throughout project implementation, a functional grievance redressmechanism for Parts 1, 3 and 4.A of the project, with adequate staffing and processes, and in form and substance satisfactory tothe Association, to register, hear and determine fairly and in good faith all complaints raised in relation to Parts 1, 3 and 4.Aof the project, and take all measures necessary to implement the determinations made by such mechanism in a manner satisfactory tothe Association.

FA WAPP, Schedule 2, Section II, B (a) and (b). The WAPP, through the PMU, shall prepare, under terms of reference satisfactory tothe Association and on the basis of the Monitoring and Evaluation Indicators, and furnish to the Association , not later than July25, 2022, a report integrating the results of the monitoring and evaluation activities of the project and setting out the measuresrecommended to ensure the efficient carrying out of Parts 1, 3 and 4.A of the project and achievement of the objectives thereofduring the period following such date, and thereafter, shall review with the Association, not later than September 25, 2022, orsuch later date as the Association shall request, said report and take all measures required to ensure the efficient completion ofParts 1, 3 and 4.A of the project and the achievement of the objective thereof, based on the conclusions and recommendations of thesaid report and the Association 's views on the matter.

If during the implementation of the project, the Association determines that Project Affected Persons were: (i) not included in thecensus survey of a Resettlement Action Plan; and (ii) occupying the project area prior to the cut-off date established in aResettlement Action Plan, the WAPP shall cause the PMU to update such Resettlement Action Plan to include these Project AffectedPersons.

The WAPP shall ensure that all technical assistance under Parts 1, 3 and 4.A of the project, the application of whose results wouldhave environmental or social implications, shall only be undertaken pursuant to terms of reference reviewed and found satisfactoryby the Association, such terms of reference to ensure that the technical assistance takes into consideration, and calls forapplication of the Safeguards Policies and the relevant Participating Countries own laws relating to the environment and socialaspects

The WAPP shall ensure that all the bidding documents and contracts include the obligation of the relevant contractors andsubcontractors: (i) to adopt and implement measures to assess and manage the risks and impacts of labor influx and workers camps;and (ii) to adopt and enforce codes of conduct that should be provided to and signed by all workers; as applicable to such civilworks commissioned or carried out pursuant to said contracts.

The WAPP shall ensure that the PMU carry out the five biodiversity action plans which are part of the ESMP adopted by Nigerpromptly with due diligence and efficiency, both prior to, and during, the construction of the North Core Regional Interconnector

The WAPP shall ensure that the obligation to comply with the relevant Safeguards Instruments is incorporated: (i) in the contractswith the relevant contractors and any entity (including any engineer) supervising the project's civil works; and (ii) in thecontracts between the relevant contractors and the contractors subcontractors.
The WAPP shall take all measures to implement the Resettlement Action Plans in a manner and timeframe satisfactory to theAssociation.

The WAPP shall: (a) take all measures necessary on its part to regularly collect, compile, and submit to the Association, as partof the Project Reports, and promptly in a separate report whenever the Association may require or the circumstances warrant,information on the status of compliance with the Safeguards Instruments. Such information shall include: (i) measures taken infurtherance of the Safeguards Instruments; (ii) conditions, if any, which interfere or threaten to interfere with the smoothimplementation of the Safeguards Instruments; and (iii) remedial measures taken or required to be taken to address suchconditions;(b) promptly furnish to the Association a copy of each quarter progress report prepared and submitted by any entity(including any engineer) supervising the project's civil works, the project's contractors and/or subcontractors; and(c) promptlyupon receipt, furnish to the Association any notification received from any entity (including any engineer) supervising theproject's civil works, the project's contractors and/or subcontractors regarding any incident that have might occurred duringproject implementation.
